elements.label: Workspace
elements.helpText:
The selected folder is used as the workspace where all intermediate and output files will be written.

If the selected folder does not exist, it will be created.

If datasets already exist in the selected folder, they will be overwritten.

elements.label: Results Suffix (Optional)
elements.helpText: A string that will be added to the end of the output uris.

elements.label: Precipitation (Raster)
elements.helpText: A GDAL-supported raster file containing non-zero, average annual precipitation values for each cell. The precipitation values should be in millimeters (mm).

elements.label: Reference Evapotranspiration (Raster)
elements.helpText: A GDAL-supported raster file containing annual average reference evapotranspiration values for each cell. The reference evapotranspiration values should be in millimeters (mm).

elements.label: Depth To Root Restricting Layer (Raster)
elements.helpText: A GDAL-supported raster file containing an average root restricting layer depth value for each cell. The root restricting layer depth value should be in millimeters (mm).

elements.label: Plant Available Water Fraction (Raster)
elements.helpText: A GDAL-supported raster file containing plant available water content values for each cell. The plant available water content fraction should be a value between 0 and 1.

elements.label: Land Use (Raster)
elements.helpText: A GDAL-supported raster file containing LULC code (expressed as integers) for each cell.

elements.label: Watersheds (Vector)
elements.helpText: An OGR-supported vector file containing one polygon per watershed. Each polygon that represents a watershed is required to have a field 'ws_id' that is a unique integer which identifies that watershed.

elements.label: Sub-Watersheds (Vector) (Optional)
elements.helpText: An OGR-supported vector file with one polygon per sub-watershed within the main watersheds specified in the Watersheds shapefile. Each polygon that represents a sub-watershed is required to have a field 'subws_id' that is a unique integer which identifies that sub-watershed.

elements.label: Biophysical Table (CSV)
elements.helpText: A CSV table of land use/land cover (LULC) classes, containing data on biophysical coefficients used in this model. The following columns are required: 'lucode' (integer), 'root_depth' (mm), 'Kc' (coefficient).

elements.label: Z parameter
elements.helpText: Floating point value on the order of 1 to 30 corresponding to the seasonal distribution of precipitation.

elements.label: Water Demand Table (CSV)
elements.helpText: A CSV table of LULC classes, showing consumptive water use for each land-use/land-cover type. The table requires two column fields: 'lucode' and 'demand'. The demand values should be the estimated average consumptive water use for each land-use/land-cover type. Water use should be given in cubic meters per year for a pixel in the land-use/land-cover map. NOTE: the accounting for pixel area is important since larger areas will consume more water for the same land-cover type.

elements.label: Hydropower Valuation Table (CSV)
elements.helpText: A CSV table of hydropower stations with associated model values. The table should have the following column fields: 'ws_id', 'efficiency', 'fraction', 'height', 'kw_price', 'cost', 'time_span', and 'discount'.
